definition: (literary) halls (of a palace or a temple)

sentences.english: Consider now, for the Lord has chosen you to build a temple as a sanctuary.
sentences.chinese: 你當謹慎，因耶和華揀選你建造殿宇作爲聖所。

sentences.english: The structure of palace house has differences between the outer palace and the inner court.
sentences.chinese: 宮中殿宇佈設格局有外朝與內廷之分。

sentences.english: What kind of house will you build for me? says the Lord. Or where will my resting place be?
sentences.chinese: 你們要爲我造何等的殿宇，那裏是我安息的地方呢。

sentences.english: And he said unto me, This chamber, whose prospect is toward the south, is for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the house.
sentences.chinese: 他對我說，這朝南的屋子是爲看守殿宇的祭司。

sentences.english: But it was Solomon who built the house for him.
sentences.chinese: 卻是所羅門爲神造成殿宇。

sentences.english: I have built a magnificent temple for you, a place for you to dwell forever.
sentences.chinese: 但我已經建造殿宇作你的居所，爲你永遠的住處。

sentences.english: And that the corner-stone of the temple is not higher than the lowest stone in its foundation.
sentences.chinese: 而殿宇的隅石並不高於那最底層的基石。

sentences.english: These buildings are bent scale, the Tibetan complex type.
sentences.chinese: 這些殿宇規模宏大，均爲曲型的藏式建築羣。

definition: main hall of a Buddhist temple
Hall of Great Strength, main hall of a Buddhist temple containing the main image of veneration 大雄[da4 xiong2]
main hall of a Buddhist temple
